data.title: CommQuest Services, Inc. on LinkedIn: #leadership #commquestacademy #inclusiveleadership #growth #teamcommquest…
data.meta_description:
Exciting News!

We’re thrilled to announce the completion of our first CommQuest Academy Leadership Series! Designed to cultivate the next generation of…
data.text:
Let's break the stigma and normalize disabilities to embrace diversity, promote inclusion, and celebrate every individual's unique abilities. By fostering understanding and acceptance, we create a world where everyone feels valued and empowered. We want to share two of our podcasts from veteran's in our organization who explain how they cope with their own PTSD while letting others know that help is available. At CommQuest, we deeply appreciate the unique experiences of individuals with disabilities. During Disability Pride Month, we want to celebrate their strength, resilience, and contributions to our community. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and feel valued. Check out both of these podcasts below: Ben: https://lnkd.in/gekWd8Z6 Robert: https://lnkd.in/g-vc_hRZ

This year's Castle 5K Run for Hope, presented by CommQuest & Alliance Rotary, takes place on Monday, September 2nd, 2024. Both organizations share a dedication to build and maintain a healthy community. CommQuest's mission is to provide HOPE to those in our community struggling with mental health, addiction, and social needs. - The chip-timed 5K begins and finishes at Glamorgan Castle. The address is: 200 Glamorgan Street, Alliance, OH 44601. - Participants receive a unique soft-blend shirt and custom finisher medal!

It's Moms Baby Shower month! We wanted to re-share and discuss supporting mothers in recovery with our guest, Brooke Burkett. Brooke is a Clinical Supervising Counselor and the MOM + Me Recovery Program Coordinator at CommQuest. Brooke addresses the stigma often surrounding mothers in recovery. At CommQuest, we strive to create a welcoming and non-judgmental environment for all our clients and understand the unique needs of mothers in recovery. Tune in to learn how CommQuest supports mothers on their recovery journey. Listen here now: https://buff.ly/49YrzBO https://buff.ly/3IChvCh https://buff.ly/3ViXAQn

Exciting Opportunity for Counseling Interns! Are you a master’s level student looking for a meaningful practicum placement? CommQuest is now accepting applications for Fall 2024! Join our dedicated team and gain hands-on experience in a supportive and inclusive environment. At CommQuest, you’ll have the chance to: - Work with diverse populations - Develop your counseling skills - Receive mentorship from experienced professionals - Make a positive impact in our community If you’re passionate, empathetic, and eager to learn, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now for Fall 2024 placements. For more information, email your resume to HR@CommQuest.org. Start your journey with CommQuest and make a difference! https://lnkd.in/g_nVvP2S #counselinginternship #Fall2024 #practicumplacement #mentalhealth #joinourteam

You can help moms and babies in your community get a solid start by supporting our baby shower! Our moms are working hard to recover and be a mom at the same time. The Mom+Me program at CommQuest is having a virtual baby shower throughout the month of July to collect much needed supplies like diapers, wipes, binkies and more for the moms we care for in recovery. You can purchase items using our Amazon baby shower registry, or make a monetary donation at www.commquest.org/moms.You can also donate new or gently used baby items size preemie to 2T. Contact us at 330.830.3394 to make arrangements for pickup/drop off, or drop off items to our Market Avenue location. We also have donation boxes at Community One Credit Unions located in Downtown Canton or Jackson Township. All donations are tax deductible, and all help is appreciated!

Are you a licensed counselor, social worker, or chemical dependency counselor looking to earn Continuing Education Units? Or do you aspire to become a Chemical Dependency Counselor Assistant? Our virtual 10-course series offers 40 CEUs (4 per class), approved by the Ohio Chemical Dependency Professionals Board (OCDPB), including ethics CEUs. Dates: July 8th - July 12th, 2024 Time: 8 AM - 12 PM and 1 PM - 5 PM Why Attend? - Earn 40 CEUs approved by the OCDPB - Fulfill all requirements for CDCA Phase I and II - Gain essential knowledge and skills in chemical dependency treatment - Convenient online classes with links sent after registration Register Now and take the next step in your professional journey! https://lnkd.in/gatxdkCu

When you are in that place of addiction, you don’t think there is anything else out there. This is it. But as you go through your recovery, step by step, you can feel good about yourself again… one positive thing after another.” Our guest on this episode of the CommQuest Hope Discovered Podcast is Suzanne Parsons who works in our women’s residential program here at CommQuest. Suzanne shares her personal journey of substance use and recovery, and she is an enthusiastic advocate for the recovery community. She hopes sharing her story will inspire others to begin and maintain their own sobriety journey. Listen here now: https://lnkd.in/e3Qv_Gnm You can also find us on your favorite podcast platform: Spotify- https://lnkd.in/eeBpd7iq Apple Music- https://lnkd.in/ex62T7p9 Youtube- https://lnkd.in/e_zHm--G
